Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
God himself created the true Guru Nanak.
Becoming Sikh of the Guru, Guru Angad joined this family.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKu hY gur Amru siqgur BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhu Hai Gur Amaru Satigur Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Liked by the true Guru, Guru Amar Das became Sikh of the Guru.
Then Ram Das, the Sikh of the Guru came to be known as the Guru.
Thereafter came Guru Arjan as the disciple of the Guru (and got established as the Guru).
Hargobind, the Sikh of the Guru cannot remain concealed even if somebody wishes to (and this further means that all the Gurus had the same light).
All the Gurus had the same light
The Gurmukh (Guru Nanak) by becoming the philosopher's stone made all the disciples venerable.

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu ieku Dwqu joiq jgwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Joti Jagaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He illumined the people of all the varnas as the philosopher's stone converts all the right metals into gold.
By becoming sandalwood he made all the trees fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKu isKu gur hoie Acrju idKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhu Sikhu Gur Hoi Acharaju Dikhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He accomplished the wonder of making disciple the Guru.
Extended his light similarly as a lamp is lit by another lamp.
As the water mixing with water becomes one, likewise deleting ego, the Sikh merges into the Guru.
The gurmukh

lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Janamu Satiguru Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The life of that Gurmukh is successful who has met the true Guru.
The Gurmukh who has surrendered before the Guru is a blest one and his fate is perfect one.
The true Guru, by giving him place around his feet has made him remember the name (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: Gr hI ivic audwsu n ivAwpY mwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghar Hee Vichi Udaasu N Viaapai Maaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now being detached, he remains at home and maya does not affect him.
By putting into practice the teachings of the Guru, he has realised he invisible Lord.
Losing his ego, the Guru-orientated Gurmukh has become liberated though still embodied.
The Gurmukhs only sustain the anbearable cup of love

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Awp gvwie n Awpu gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukhs erase their ego and never allow themselves to be noticed.
Effacing duality, they venerate only one Lord.
Accepting Guru as God they by cultivating the words of the Guru, translate them into life.
The Gurmukhs serve and attain the fruits of happiness.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK kwr kmwie suK Plu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Kaar Kamaai Soukh Phalu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This way receiving the cup of love,
They bear the effect of this unbearable in their mind.
Daily routine of the Gurmukh
The Guru-orientated gets up early in the morning and makes others also to do so.
Discarding delusions is equal to bathing at the holy places for him.
Gurmukh carefully and attentively recites the moolmantar.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK inhclu hoie iek min iDAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Nihachalu Hoi Ik Mani Dhiaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukh single-mindedly concentrates upon the Lord.
The red mark of love adorns his forehead.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY gur isK pYrI pwieAw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Gur Sikh Pairee Paaiaa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Falling on the feet of the Sikhs of the Guru and thus through his own humility, he makes others surrender to his feet.
The earning of Gurmukh
Touching the feet, the Sikhs of the Guru wash their feet.

lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Vaanee Chakhi Manu Vasi Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then they taste the ambrosial word (of Guru) through which the mind is controlled.
They fetch water, fan the sangat and put wood in the firebox of the kitchen.
They listen to, write and make others write the hymns of the Gurus.
They practice the remembrance of Lords name, charity and ablutions.

lines.gurmukhi: inv clxu imT bol Gwil KvwieAw ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Niv Chalanu Mitd Bol Ghaali Khavaaiaa ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: They walk in humility, speak sweetly, and eat the earning of their own hands.
Metting of the Sikhs of the Guru
The Sikhs of Guru meet the Sikhs of the Guru.
Bound by the loving devotion, they celebrate the anniversaries of the Guru.
For them, the Sikh of the Guru is the god, goddess and the father.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK mwN ipau vIr kutMb sbwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Maan Piu Veer Koutanb Sabaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mother, father, brother and the family also is the Sikh of the Guru.
Meeting to the Sikhs of the Guru is farming business as well as other gainful occupations for the Sikh.
The progeny of the swan like Sikhs of Guru is also the Sikh of the Guru.
Omens

lines.gurmukhi: sjw Kbw sauxu n mMin vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sajaa Khabaa Saounu N Manni Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukhs never take to their heart the omen on the right or the left.

lines.gurmukhi: nwir purK no vyiK n pYru htwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Purakh No Vaykhi N Pairu Hataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They do not retrace their steps while seeing a man or woman.

lines.gurmukhi: BwK suBwK vIcwir n iCk mnwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaakh Soubhaakh Veechaari N Chhik Manaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They do not pay attention to the crises of animals or sneezing.

lines.gurmukhi: dyvI dyv n syv n pUj krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvee Dayv N Sayvi N Pooj Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Goddess and gods are neither served nor worshipped by them.

lines.gurmukhi: BMBl BUsy Kwie n mn BrmwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhanbhal Bhoosay Khaai N Manu Bharamaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By not entangling in deceits, they do not allow their minds to wander.
The Gursikhs have sowed the seed of truth in the field of life and have made it fruitful.
Holy congregation, abode the truth

lines.gurmukhi: ikrq ivriq mnu Drmu scu idVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kirati Virati Manu Dharamu Sachu Dirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For earning livelihood, the Gurmukhs keep in mind, the dharma and always remember the truth.
They know that the creator himself has created (and diffused) the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur purKu dieAwlu dieAw kir AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Purakhu Daiaalu Daiaa Kari Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That true Guru, the supreme one, compassionately has descended on earth.
Personifying the formless into the form of Word He has recited it for one and all.
The Guru has founded the high mound of the holy congregation known also as the abode of truth.
There only establishing the true throne he has made all to bow and salute.
Services to the holy congregation
The Sikhs of the Guru inspire the Sikhs of the Guru to serve.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq kir syv suK Plu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Kari Sayv Soukh Phalu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Serving the holy congregation they receive the fruit of happiness.
Sweeping and spreading the sitting mats they bathe in the dust of the holy congregation.
They bring unused pitchers and fill them with water (to get it cold).
They bring sacred food (maha parshad), distribute it among others and eat.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 bury nwl Blw krn dy ivKy

Shabad OS B.translation: Do good to evil person
Tree is there in the world and keeps its head downward.
It stands steadfast and maintains its head low.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie suPl Pl sPlu vt shwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Suphal Phalu Saphalu Vat Sahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then becoming full of fruits it bears the stone-blows.
Further it gets sawed and causes to make ship.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI dy isir vwt rwhu clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Day Siri Vaat Raahu Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now it moves on the head of water.
Having borne iron-saw upon head, it carries the same iron (used in ship making) across the water.
The tree bears the evil and does the good
With the help of iron the tree is cut and pruned and iron nails are stuck into it.
But the tree carry iron on its head keeps it floating on water.

lines.gurmukhi: AwpnVw puqu pwil n nIir fubwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aapanarhaa Poutu Paali N Neeri Doubaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The water also considering it its adopted son does not make it sink.
But the sandalwood is sunk intentionally to make it costlier.

lines.gurmukhi: gux kIqy gux hoie jgu pqIAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Goun Keetay Goun Hoi Jagu Pateeaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The quality of goodness produces goodness and the whole world also remains happy.

lines.gurmukhi: Avgux sih guxu krY Goil GumwieAw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Avagoun Sahi Gounu Karai Gholi Ghoumaaiaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who does good in return of evil.
Orders of the true Guru
Who accepts the order (will) of Lord makes the whole world accept His order (Hukam).
The order of the Guru is that the will of the Lord be accepted positively.
Drinking the cup of loving devotion, they visualise the invisible (Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK AlKu lKwie n AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Alakhu Lakhaai N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukhs even having seen (realised) do not go on divulging this mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Awpu gvwie n Awpu gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs delete ego from the self and never allow themselves to be noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu pwie bIj PlwieAw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paai Beej Phalaaiaa ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru-orientated ones acquire the fruit of happiness and spread its seeds all around.
Love of a disciple
Having the sight of the true Guru, the Sikh of the Guru concentrates upon Him.
Pondering upon the word of true Guru he cultivates knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl gur mMqu iciq vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Gur Mantu Chiti Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He keeps to his heart the mantra and the lotus feet of Guru.
He serves the true Guru and consequently makes the whole world serve him.
The Guru loves disciple and disciple makes the whole world happy.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQu clwie inj Gir CwieAw ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaai Nij Ghari Chhaaiaa ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way, that disciple creates a religion of the Gurmukhs and situates in his own self.
Yoga-technique for Gurmukh
Guru has explained the technique of yoga to the Sikhs.
Remain detached amidst all the hopes and cravings.
Eat less food and drink little water.

lines.gurmukhi: QoVw bolx bol n JiK JKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dorhaa Bolan Boli N Jhakhi Jhakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Speak less and do not talk nonsensical.

lines.gurmukhi: QoVI rwqI nId n moih PhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dorhee Raatee Need N Mohi Dhahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sleep less and do not be caught in any infatuation.

lines.gurmukhi: suhxy AMdir jwie n loB luBwieAw ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Suhanay Andari Jaai N Lobh Loubhaaiaa ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Sleep less and do not be caught in any infatuation.
Yoga-technique for Gursikhs
The sermon of the Guru is the earrings of a yogi.

lines.gurmukhi: iKMQw iKmw isvwie JolI piq mwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Khindaa Khimaa Sivaai Jholee Pati Maaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Forgiveness is the patched blanket and in the beggar's bad is the name of the Lord of maya (God).

lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Bibhoot Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Humbly touching of the feet ashes.
Cup of love is the bowl, which is filled with the food of affection.
Knowledge is the staff with which the messengers of different propensities of mind are cultured.
Holy congregation is the tranquil cave wherein the yogi resides in equipoise.
Other means of yoga-technique for  Gursikhs
The knowledge about the supreme is the trumpet (singi) of yogi and the recitation of the word is its playing upon.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK AweI pMQu inj Gru AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aaee Pandu Nij Gharu Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The best assembly of gurmukhs i.e. the Ai panth, could be attained by settling in one's own home.
Such people (Gurmukhs) bow before the primal Lord and have the sight of the invisible (God).
The disciples and the Gurus have enrapt themselves in the mutual love for one another.
Getting above of the worldly affairs, they meet (their ultimate destiny) the Lord.
World, the game of dice

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK suix gurisK isK sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Souni Gurasikh Sikhu Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having listened to the teaching of Guru,
The Sikh of Guru has called other Sikhs.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK suix kir Bwau mMin vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Souni Kari Bhaau Manni Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Adopting the teachings of the Guru,
The Sikh has recited the same to others.

lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Gurasikh Sangu Mayli Milaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs of the Guru have liked the Sikhs and thus a Sikh has met the Sikhs.

lines.gurmukhi: caupiV solh swr jug ijix AwieAw ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Chaouparhi Solah Saar Joug Jini Aaiaa ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: The pair of the Guru and the disciple has conquered the world-game of oblong dice.
The game of chess
The chess players have spread the chess mat.
Elephants, chariots, horses and pedestrians have been brought in.

lines.gurmukhi: huie piqswhu vjIr duie dl CwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hui Patisaahu Vajeer Dui Dal Chhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The groups of kings and ministers have gathered and are fighting tooth and nail.
The groups of kings and ministers have gathered and are fighting tooth and nail.
The Gurmukh by making a move has opened his heart before the Guru.
The Guru has lifted pedestrian to the rank of minister and has placed him in the palace of success (and thus has saved the life game of the disciple).
Living in the fear of God, Gurmukhs attain formless God

lines.gurmukhi: BY ivic inmix inim BY ivc jwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhai Vichi Nimani Nimi Bhai Vichi Jaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Under the natural law (fear of lord), the jiva (creature) is conceived (by mother) and in the fear (law) he is born.

lines.gurmukhi: BY ivic gurmuiK pMiQ srxI AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhai Vichi Guramoukhi Panthi Saranee Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In fear he comes in the shelter of the way (panth) of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: BY ivic sMgiq swD sbdu kmwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhai Vichi Sangati Saadh Sabadu Kamaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In fear while in the holy congregation he earns the merit of the True Word

lines.gurmukhi: BY ivic jIvnu mukiq Bwxw BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhai Vichi Jeevanu Moukati Bhaanaa Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In fear (natural laws) he gets liberated in life and accepts the will of God happily.

lines.gurmukhi: BY ivic jnmu svwir shij smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhai Vichi Janamu Savaari Sahaji Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In fear he leaves away this life and merges in equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: BY ivic inj Gir jwie pUrw pwieAw ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhai Vichi Nij Ghari Jaai Pooraa Paaiaa ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: In fear he settles in his self and attains the supreme Perfect Being.
In praise of the Guru
Those who, accepting Guru as God have sought shelter in the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gur crxI icqu lwie n clY clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Charanee Chitu Laai N Chalai Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who have put their heart at the feet of Lord, never become perishable.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq inhcl hoie inj pdu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Nihachalu Hoi Nij Pad Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They, getting deeply rooted in the wisdom of Guru, attain themselves.
They adopt the daily routine of the Gurmukhs, and Gods Will becomes dear to them.
As Gurmukhs, losing their ego, they merge in the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: sPlu jnmu jig Awie jgqu qrwieAw ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Saphalu Janamu Jagi Aai Jagatu Taraaiaa ?21?20?veeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: Their birth in the world is meaningful and they across the whole world also.
One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl dieAw kY idKwvY jwih qwih Awn rUp rMg dyKy nwhI BwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Daiaa Kai Dikhaavai Jaahi , Taahi Aan Roop Rang Daykhay Naahee Bhaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who is blessed by Satguru with spiritual wisdom, he does not like to see any other form or attraction. Nothing else can give tranquility and peace to such a blessed person.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl mieAw kY cKwvY jwih qwih Anrs nhIN rsnw ihqwvhI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Maiaa Kai Chakhaavai Jaahi , Taahi Anaras Naheen Rasanaa Hitaavahee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who is blessed with spiritual pleasure by the True Guru, he does not relish any other pleasures.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl Aghu ghwvY jwih srb inDwn prsn kau n DwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Agahu Gahaavai Jaahi , Sarab Nidhaan Parasan Kau N Dhaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A devout Sikh who is blessed with the spiritual pleasure that no one can reach to, he need not run after other worldly relishments.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl AlK lKwvY jwih AkQ kQw ibnod vwhI bin AwveI ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Alakh Lakhaavai Jaahi , Akad Kadaa Binod Vaahee Bani Aavaee ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only he who is blessed with self-realization (spiritual knowledge) can feel its pleasure and this cannot be explained. The devotee himself can only appreciate the pleasure of that state. (20)
